        public static javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory getClientCertSocketFactoryPEM(java.lang.String pemPath,
                                                                           boolean verifyPeer)
                                                                    throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                                           java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                           java.io.IOException,
                                                                           java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                                                           java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                                                                           java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                                                           java.security.KeyManagementException,
                                                                           java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Obtain a SSLSocketFactory that provides a client certificate from a PEM file and optionally verifies the server's certificate.
        Parameters:
        pemPath - Path to the PEM file
        verifyPeer - true to use the default trust store to verify the server, false to accept the server's certificate regardless of attributes
        Returns:
        The SSLSocketFactory
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the PEM file cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - If unable to read the PEM file
        java.security.KeyStoreException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        java.security.KeyManagementException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - If unable to create the SocketFactory

      • parseDERFromPEM

        public static byte[] parseDERFromPEM(byte[] pem,
                                     java.lang.String beginDelimiter,
                                     java.lang.String endDelimiter)
        Parse PEM encoded bytes between type delimiters and return the DER encoded bytes. A PEM file may contain one or more of: a certificate, private key, public key, certificate signing request, certificate signing request response. The items in a PEM file each have a beginning and end delimiter. Example delimiters: -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- -----END CERTIFICATE----- PEM encoded bytes are base64 encoded. This method will convert the bytes back into non-base64 encoded binary. This method may need to be called more than once; each time with different delimiters, if the input bytes contain multiple items (i.e. both certificate and private key).
        Parameters:
        pem - The bytes to parse
        beginDelimiter - The begin delimiter
        endDelimiter - The end delimiter
        Returns:
        The DER encoded bytes

      • generateRSAPrivateKeyFromDER

        public static java.security.interfaces.RSAPrivateKey generateRSAPrivateKeyFromDER(byte[] keyBytes)
                                                                           throws java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                                                                  java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Generates an RSAPrivateKey from an array of DER encoded bytes.
        Parameters:
        keyBytes - the bytes
        Returns:
        The RSAPrivateKey
        Throws:
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - If unable to create a key from the bytes
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If RSA is not supported in this JVM
